Output Modules.​PIT_MAIL.​MAIL Body

Package to wrap sending mails via UTL_SMTP

Author

Juergen Sieben, ConDeS GmbH

Private Constants
Email constants
CR

Carriage return, taken from <UTL_TCP>

C_BOUNDARY

Boundary string to separate parts within a mail

C_PARAM_GROUP

Name of the parameter group

Private global variables
email related global variables
g_host

Host of the email server

g_port

Portnummer of the email server

g_usr

Name of the user to authenticate with the email server

g_pwd

Password of the user to authenticate with the email server

g_sender

Email address of the sender

g_encoding

Encoding to use for the mails

g_is_multipart_mail

Flag to indicate whether a mail is a multipart mail

g_html_content_type

Header information for an email in HTML format

g_multipart_content_type

Header information for a multipart email

g_trace_text

Trace information, is filled upon sending a mail

Private Helper Methods
mail_server_access_granted
function mail_server_access_granted
return boolean

Checks whether a mail server has granted access succesfully.

Returns

Flag to indicate whether the user could authenticate at the mail server (TRUE) or not (FALSE)

mail_server_accessible
function mail_server_accessible
return boolean

Checks whether a mail server can be contacted over the net succesfully.

Returns

Flag to indicate whether the mail server could be contacted (TRUE) or not (FALSE)

encode_item
function encode_item(
p_item in varchar2
)
return varchar2

Method to convert text to an encoded data island.

This method is a wrapper around <UTL_ENCODE>.quoted_printable_encode.

Parameter
p_item
in varchar2

Element to encode

Returns

Encoded value of <p_item>

create_address_list
function create_address_list(
p_address_list in varchar2
)
return address_tab

Method to convert a semicolon-delimited list of email addresses into an instance of <ADDRESS_TAB>.

Parameter
p_address_list
in varchar2

emicolon-delimited list of email addresses

Returns

Instance of <ADDRESS_TAB>

extract_mail_address
function extract_mail_address(
p_address in varchar2
)
return varchar2

Method to extract the mail address from an address of form "user.name <email_address>" or "email_address".

Parameter
p_address
in varchar2

address of form "user.name <email_address>" or "email_address".

Returns

Email address portion of <p_address>

encode_mail_address
function encode_mail_address(
p_address in varchar2
)
return varchar2

Method to encode the mail address

Parameter
p_address
in varchar2

address of form "user.name <email_address>" or "email_address".

Returns

Email address with an encoded user name portion, if present

write_log
procedure write_log(
p_text in varchar2
)

Method to write connection or process steps to g_trace_text

Parameter
p_text
in varchar2

Text to add to g_trace_text

write_header
procedure write_header(
p_conn in out nocopy utl_smtp.connection,
p_item in varchar2,
p_text in varchar2
)

Method to write header information in the correct format

Parameters
p_conn
in out nocopy utl_smtp.connection

<UTL_SMTP> connection

p_item
in varchar2

Header item to write

p_text
in varchar2

Header item value to write

p_text in varchar2
)

Parameters
p_conn
in out nocopy utl_smtp.connection

<UTL_SMTP> connection

p_text
in varchar2

Body text to write

write_boundary
procedure write_boundary(
p_conn in out nocopy utl_smtp.connection,
p_last_boundary in boolean default false
)

Method to write boundary text to the <UTL_SMTP> connection

Parameters
p_conn
in out nocopy utl_smtp.connection

<UTL_SMTP> connection

p_last_boundary
in boolean

Flag to indicate whether this is the last boundary of the mail.  If TRUE, the method adds a comment to close the boundary sections.

authenticate_via_login
procedure authenticate_via_login(
p_conn in out nocopy utl_smtp.connection
)

Method to authenticate at the mail server. User credentials are taken from g_usr and g_pwd global variables.

Parameters
p_conn
in out nocopy utl_smtp.connection

<UTL_SMTP> connection

authenticate_via_plain
procedure authenticate_via_plain(
p_conn in out nocopy utl_smtp.connection
)

Method to authenticate at the mail server via AUTH PLAIN mechanism.  User credentials are taken from g_usr and g_pwd global variables.

Parameters
p_conn
in out nocopy utl_smtp.connection

<UTL_SMTP> connection

connect_mail_server
procedure connect_mail_server(
p_conn out nocopy utl_smtp.connection
)

Method to connect the mail server and authenticate.

The method reacts on the initial reply of the mail server to decide upon the authentication mechanisma to use. LOGIN and PLAIN are support directly within this package, CRAM and NTLM via package MAIL_CRAM and MAIL_NTLM respectively.

Parameters
p_conn
out nocopy utl_smtp.connection

<UTL_SMTP> connection

set_recipient_list
procedure set_recipient_list(
p_conn in out nocopy utl_smtp.connection,
p_sender in varchar2,
p_subject in varchar2,
p_recipients in mail.address_tab,
p_cc_recipients in mail.address_tab
)

Method to set the recipients list for the mail.

Parameters
p_conn
in out nocopy utl_smtp.connection

<UTL_SMTP> connection

p_sender
in varchar2

Sender of the mail

p_subject
in varchar2

Subject of the mail

p_recipients
in mail.address_tab

Instance of <ADDRESS_TAB> with the recipients

p_cc_recipients
in mail.address_tab

Instance of <ADDRESS_TAB> with the cc_recipients
